Reviews.Title: “hesperia del port”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel staff was friendly and the location was very good. 5 min walk from la rambla ,15 min from the beach and there is a metro station 200 meters from the hotel. the room was old but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Irina B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a long week-end and I have to say it's a great location-close to the beach,Las Ramblas and about 15 walk from Placa de Spania. We arrived a bit early but they gave us a room(small but very clean) straight away.Staff was very friendly and helpful -we borough an iron and a hairdryer with no problem at all.Also when we left we gave back the keys and they kept our luggage all day for free. We didn't eat in the hotel but we found a great restaurant about 5 minutes on your right as you come out of the hotel.Lunch was 9 euros for a 3 course meal and wine per person.Incredible :) I'll definitely go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need from a city break hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CatB1985
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a brillaint 3 day stay at the Hesperia Del Port. The hotel was very easy to get to from the airport - take the train to Barcelona Saints and change onto the Green L3 metro line to Paral-lel and walk for 2 mins to the hotel. Ticket only cost €9.25 and got 2 people there and back (ticket is for 10 trips and does not go out of date). The location is very handy to see the whole of Barcelona. I would say a 10 min walk to the Ramblas. I would recommend walking the major roads at night as the small back roads were a little uncomfortable. The hotel rooms are clean and modern - brilliant shower. Rooms could have done with being a little bigger but this is not essential as we spent little time in the hotel room - why would you when there is a beautiful city to see. The beds were a little hard, but this did not disturb our sleep and actually slept very well every night. The reception staff were very friendly - especially the night receptionist. Had a good chat with him every evening on our return. There is also a little supermarket next door to the hotel for essentials. I would not hesitate to stay again, but i would probably stay somewhere East of the Ramblas next time.

Reviews.Title: “¨Definitely below expectations for an Hesperia. Average even for NH.”
Reviews.Author: Huaso111
Reviews.Content: Not very good experience. It is a very basic hotel. Dark rooms, with no space at all. Poor breakfast that was not ready by 7h00 which is it's opening hour.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: paulhaych
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in March 2012 with a friend. Easy to reach from the airport via train and metro (nearest metro station is Paral-el which is a 2/3 min walk). We booked a twin room which was very small and had to twin beds right beside each other. Room was quite modern and clean and had a mini fridge (€2 for a soft drink or beer, or €3 for a drink and a packet of crisps) but didn't go near it as there was a shop right next door to the hotel. Staff were nice and friendly and we're happy to help whenever i needed assistance. Wifi is complimentary however it is very slow and kept cutting off after 5 mins. I would have preferred to have paid for decent wifi than be giving free wifi connection that hardly worked. Theres a computer downstairs in the lobby however you have to pay to use it and it was quite expensive to use too. Breakfast was OK but overpriced. Not worth the €9 each morning for what was offered (cereal, mini croissants, cheese, ham, eggs, bacon etc) and staff were very slow in refilling the drinks and hot food. It's a nice hotel and I cannot fault the location however i don't think I'll stay here the next time i visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Might be tolerable if you get room away from street”
Reviews.Author: clntard
Reviews.Content: A very convenient location with nice service staff. Rooms are very clean, but basic. Of the 3 hotels I stayed in during my trip to BCN, this was the only one where I couldn't sleep. The windows were so poorly insulated you could hear the street noises almost same as with window open. As they were overbooked for a trade show, there wasn't an option to switch. In addition, the bed was so hard BOTH my shoulders hurt the next days. Which has NEVER happened on a trip in the last 13 years. The breakfast was okay, with exception they would leave their scrambled eggs out until they were cold, without being under a heat lamp, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Constructionman53
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stopped at the Hesperia in January 2012 for a long weekend (Friday to Monday). The hotel is clean and functional with a good location for the Port and La Rambla. The staff are polite but do not enthuse and can appear quite indifferent. Rooms are clean however it is disappointing they only changed hand towels in the time we stopped – bath towels were not changed. We didn’t use the breakfast room, at 9 euro each its nonsense when for 10 euro we could both eat a hearty breakfast in a café only 10m away. Having said all of that it was cheap and cheerful and “you gets what you pays for”

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: mucky
Reviews.Content: Just back from Barcelona, where we stayed from 28th Dec 2011 to 1st Jan 2012. We decided to stay at the Hesperia Del Port hotel for a couple of reasons, firstly good value and secondly a reasonably good location away from Ramblas but within easy walking distance. When we arrived we were pleased with the hotel, the surrounding area was a bit run down to be honest, but this didn't matter too much. Reception doors were kept closed and entry was via the receptionist letting you in. Was this a sign of trouble we thought? We checked in, through a nice reception with friendly staff and were allocated room 702. Top floor overlooking a park and the road. now I was a bit concerned that the noise from the busy road would be a problem, but I needn't have worried, the windows and the height of the room shut out practically everything. Smallish room, large metal framed bed that squeaked badly with every movement, very small LCD TV. Bathroom, had bidet, toilet, bath sink and shower. Room was clean had a safe (which was not bolted down), a fridge and a wardrobe. A/C was available, although it didn't work, being December you could argue that it wasn't necessary but with the sun shining through the front glass most of the day and it was very warm in the room. There was a reasonable view over to the Olympic stadium area and we did walk there one day, it took about 10 mins up the back roads. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, it was available for €12 pp so we went down the road where there was a nice cafe serving roles and coffee at a good price. The rooms had free wifi and was great for a few days. the lack of any area except reception with sofa or comfortable chairs mean't there was no real point in being in the hotel for any time longer than necessary. Turning right out of the hotel, leads towards the Apolo theatre on av de parallel. Also any of the side roads on the right side would lead to rambles areas and beyond. Turning left out of the hotel leads down towards the port and the point where cruise ships and ferries arrive. I think this hotel is great for couples on a city break, or businessmen. There are metro stations a short walk away and the taxi cost from the airport was €35 and €40 on New years day. As there were 4 of us it was the best way. If it was 2 of us, we may have found an alternative way to the airport if cost only was the important factor.

Reviews.Title: “Can't faut the location or value”
Reviews.Author: mkh1966
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in November. The location is spot on for the old town, Port Vell & the Metro. Yes it may be in a residential area with locals cafes & restaurants nearby but those reviews who said it was in a sketchy area are clearly more nervous types. As for the room it was clean & tidy with 2 large beds & a smart bathroom with a large powerful shower. Reasonable hanging space with a good number of hangers, a few drawers, safe & mini bar. We had double doors & a very small balcony whilst other rooms just had windows. The only view from our room however was straight into the front rooms of the private apartments over the road. We did pass on the 10 Euro self service breakfast & opted for a cafe 2 doors down the road at a fraction of the price. For the money we paid I can't fault the place & would stay again if we return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kiminitaly
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms here for a 3 day weekend with friends. The hotel is in a great location - easily reached from the airport, close by to a central metro station, a 5 minute walk to La Rambla & to the port. The rooms are clean, sufficiently sized & comfortable. All 3 rooms were road facing & we had no trouble with noise levels. Some of the front desk staff could have been a little more helpful, but they were pleasant enough. Overall great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but Basic”
Reviews.Author: HarryHolidayLimerick
Reviews.Content: Hotel located 10 mins from las ramblas. Do not walk alleys and side streets around hotel. Stick to main street down towards marina when heading too and from las ramblas. Hotel is clean. No Bar but couple of cafes type bars to the right hand side of hotel. Hotel ideal for stag partys, football matches etc. Not for romantic getaways. Hotel is clean and comfortable and has a lift and 24hr reception. Metro stop 5 min walk to the right.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good location.”
Reviews.Author: JessBarr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hesperia Carlit for 2 nights and were very pleased with the room. It was clean, comfortable and worth the price. The location was ideal for us. It was a short walk (less than 5 minutes) from a metro stop and only 2 stops from Las Ramblas. We mostly walked from the hotel to may tourist sights as the weather was nice and we wanted to see the city. I'd stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Rooms, Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: Neerav77
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Barcelona back in May, and stayed at the Hesperia del Port. Barcelona is a wonderful city and we enjoyed our stay. Positives: It is an excellent location. Quick walk to the train to Montjuic, and just around the corner from Las Ramblas and the Port. Negatives: (1) The twin beds that made up the one big bed both squeeked if you moved. It woke my wife and I up most of the nights. (2) The walls are paper thin and I could hear everyone come into their rooms while we were sleeping. I could even hear someone in the neighboring bathroom singing. (3) The shower would leak into the bathroom. Made for a nasty floor. Overall, we would visit Barcelona again, but pay the extra $$$ to stay somewhere nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Port Location”
Reviews.Author: plsmith47
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at the Hesperia del Port the night before our cruise. The location was very convient. We walked to the Columbus momument area in the morning to catch the port bus to the ship. Other reviewers mentioned the "seedy" area, but we had no problem with the area. We had a wonderful paella dinner in an outdoor cafe two blocks from the hotel. Our room was simple but clean; just what we expected for a economy hotel. The staff was pleasant and even let us check in before noon since we had arrived in Barcelona on an early morning flight. We would not hesitate to stay there again if we are lucky enough to cruise from Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Hisperia Del Port, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: EmanK_11
Reviews.Content: Wish we read the review before booking. Hotel is very dreary and although good for sightseeing, was in a red light area. We, as a family of eight, stayed for 3 nights this September. We reported a broken toilet seat in one of the rooms, and it was still broken when we left. Shower leaked all over the floor and towels used for the floor were put back for use the next day by the cleaner. On returning to the hotel on the Sunday evening, the reception stank of hashish-but the hotel is non smoking!!!! Breakfast was fairly good and the breakfast staff were very helpful, not so some of the reception staff at night and the cleaning was way below standard. I would give this hotel 2 stars at a push but would not give it 3 stars at all. Avoid at all costs if you have children with you.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location, clean, with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tech-Guy73
Reviews.Content: We searched high and low for a well-priced hotel in Barcelona that was close to Las Ramblas where all the action was. This hotel exceeded our expectations and was also very close to the beach, shopping, and the waterfront. A simple but tasty morning buffet was also offered for 9 euros a day which proved handy before a full day of sight-seeing. There were also many restaurants, stores, and fruit markets within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ErikBehm
Reviews.Content: Very good for being a 3 star hotel and the price was good although it was during a very large trade fair. Breakfast not extravagant but OK for being in Soth Europe. Only bad thing was that I was placed in a smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: Slicko11
Reviews.Content: Used hotel as a stopover the night before we left on a cruise. Expected a no frills hotel with polite staff and that was exactly what we got. Room was comfortable and couple of bars just up the road. Not the most luxurious bars I grant you but they did OK for a snack. A 10 minute walk see you either at the Port Shuttle Bus or La Ramblas so that was just right and to top it all, when we dismbarked at 9.00 the following Saturday, the hotel said we could leave our cases with them for 4 or 5 hours while we shopped. Then went back, picked up cases and left for airport. In view of the price paid and the service offered by the hotel and it's staff, we couldn't fault it. Hostel? Don't believe it!

Reviews.Title: “No frills stopover on way to a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: meliberk
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here with a friend one night before boarding a cruise. This is the only circumstance for which I would recommend this hotel. My friend wanted a budget hotel and that is what we got. Small rooms make it a bad choice for families. The room was tiny and depressing, overlooking an alley. Clean enough. Old style TV with a limited selection of English channels. It was fine for one night because of proximity to the port and walking distance to sightseeing. Unless this is your set of circumstances, spend a little more and find another choice.

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor mislead us on this one! Basically an over-priced hostel.”
Reviews.Author: jamie_sommers
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for two nights based on internet reviews when we unexpectedly needed a hotel in Barcelona. We were so happy that we hadn't committed to a longer stay, and were able to get out to a nicer place ASAP! This is essentially a hostel-quality property in a red-light district. If you are looking for a skanky hotel near strip clubs and sex shops, this is the place for you! The room was small and stuffy and didn't feel especially clean. When we were leaving, we heard another customer complaining at the front desk about bed bugs and not being taken seriously! We were so happy to be out of there! One of our beds was raised up at the foot and couldn't be adjusted. The TV was the huge kind from the 80's, though it did have a good selection of cable channels. The bathroom was relatively recently remodeled, but the shower smelled and dripped water on the floor. The decor was depressing and shabby. The breakfast was not included, and was 10 Euros, even though right out the door you could get coffee and a croissant for about 3 Euros (but not before 8 AM -- it's Spain!) On the upside, it is within walking distance to many key Barcelona sites, and the staff was helpful and friendly upon check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: DublinSimoncowell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Jan for 3 nights for a football match. We got cheap flights & didnt want to spend a whole lot on our accomodation. Got a great deal for the 3 nights. We werent really expecting alot, but we were very surprised! Hotel is in a good location. No more than a 5 min walk from Las Ramblas & the port. Upon check in the hotel staff were friendly & polite. Offered us some useful tips on sight seeing & gave us our match tickets that had be delivered to the hotel for us. The lift was a bit small, but did the job & got us to our room on the top floor. The room was fine. Clean, extra bedding & modern. Stocked minibar too (dont do it - convenience shop 2 doors down - half the price!!!) The short cut that you can take to get to Las Ramblas to me, didn't seem very safe. I would advise taking the long way. Even at that there are people asleep on ebnches, begging, selling flowers etc., but I guess thats to be expected in all major cities. We didn't eat in the hotel, we ate out. There's a great Irish pub down the lane from Burger King on Las Ramblas - would definitly recommend it!! Really enjoyed our stay and would definitly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great all-round!”
Reviews.Author: rubyglittershoes
Reviews.Content: I was slightly concerned as a few reviews had said this hotel was in a seedy area however I didn't find this at all. I felt very safe walking around even in the early hours of the morning. It is on a main road, very wide and well lit. The location couldn't have been better in my opinion and there are a few nice little cafe bars within stumbling distance where the food is good and the staff are pleasant and happy to speak English. As for the hotel itself, the staff were pleasant and let us check in a little early which was good. The room was impeccably clean and air-conditioned (a must). The minibar was reasonably priced although we didn't have the crisps replaced after we scoffed them on arrival! I liked the good quality safe and nice bathroom although I would have preferred a second pillow as the big orange cushion made my eyes itch. The only real negatives for the room were that we were given a smoking room (we requested non-smoking and as we have both recently quit it was hard enough already without constant wafts of tobacco!). Also, I really missed having tea and coffee making facilities in the room. I have always had it wherever I usually stay but as this is more of a budget hotel than I would normally go for (Barcelona is expensive for hotels!!!) maybe this is the norm. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a no-frills accommodation but with a few luxury touches.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: harteja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid March on a city break with a friend. It was easy to get to the hotel, taking the bus from the airport and then the tube from Placa Catalunya and then just a short walk from the tube station. It was in a great location, just a short walk to the lovely Port and Las Ramblas and just a few tube stops from Placa Catalunya where it all seemed to start (the open top bus tours, a lot of the different tube lines} so it was a great base for all there is to do in Barcelona. The tube line that we used to get to and from the hotel stopped at a lot of the great tourist attractions- Plaza D'Espagne and the nearest stop to the Park Guell which was lovely. The hotel itself was fine. It was clean and had maid service every day which we did not expect on just a short stay. It had marble floors so was a little bit noisy in the mornings when people started to get up and we heard doors slam when people came back to their rooms late at night but i suppose you get this in most hotels. We did not have any meals in this hotel but there are plenty of little cafes in the area where we had breakfast and some lovely little bars for drinks at night. Altogether it was a great city break. The weather was fantastic and Barcelona is such a beautiful city and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Haymodad
Reviews.Content: Hotel security was great...We were on a mom/ teenage daughter get away weekend. Very quiet location even though it's on a busy street. The room was nice, clean and looked as if it had been recently updated. We even had a small balcony. Easy to navigate to from the airport. Metro station less than a block away. Located on the edge of Old Town. Just 2 blocks or so from the port and La Rambla. Fresh produce markets next door and several restaurants within the block. Free WiFi in the room was an added plus! Staff was friendly and helpful. The breakfast "buffet" was a bit pricey (about 10.00 Euro p/p), but it filled the immediate need for coffee and the first of many feedings of a teenager...nice selection of fresh fruits and breads. Selected this hotel off others recommendations on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to the Port”
Reviews.Author: jjegj5k
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 rooms at this hotel for one night before our cruise. We were very happy with this hotel. The rooms were clean and modern. Having free Wi-Fi was nice. The location of the hotel was great. We were close to Las Rambles and the metro station. We found plenty to do close to the hotel. Our luggage was delayed, and the workers at the front desk helped us by calling Iberia to check on them. Most of the luggage was delivered to the ship, which made our check-out easier. We were able to walk to the Christopher Columbus Monument and get a "Blue Bus" to take us to our cruise ship. The walk was only a few minutes, and the cost was 2 Euros. This was easier because we didn't have all our luggage, but it wouldn't have been impossible to do. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Randomxx
Reviews.Content: Nice city hotel. Rooms are small but look new and are clean. I travel a lot and I must say I appreciated getting a room with a bathroom where the sink, the water flush and shower were perfectly clean and working! Paral.lel metro station very close to the hotel. Location is ok but be careful especially when walking alone at night in this area. 2guys approached me not far from the hotel trying to steal my wallet..

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gembo8
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 4 night stay in Barcelona with a friend - we asked for twin beds at booking but when we got there only a double was available, which for us wasn't a huge imposition but I couldn't quite understand why they couldn't be made up as separate beds (it was made up of two separate beds in the first place). The room itself was fine, a little on the small side but not a problem if you're out all day sight-seeing. Excellent location, close to the port and two streets away from the bottom of La Rambla so it was ideal for all the major tourist attractions. Breakfast was included in our stay and was ok but it probably would have been better to avoid paying the price and gone to one of the many local bakeries in the surrounding streets. Barcelona generally was fantastic - amazing city, lovely food although if you're in the touristy areas the food and drink can be quite expensive. Also disappointed by the lack of fish restaurants considering it's a sea-side location and considering the quantity of fish available in the local markets. Definitely worth visiting the Mercat De La Boqueria (just off La Rambla) - the whole thing is just breathtaking. And for a true local flavour, visit the Placa Reial on Sunday morning for something quite inexplicable!!

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, good for one night stay, great location.”
Reviews.Author: JetSetter064
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hesperia del Port in early April 2010 for one night. We were enroute to join a mediteranean cruise. We arrive early before check in time and room was not ready. The staff was friendly and kept our luggage until the room was ready. We were able to leave our stuff and explore the city. The location was excellent, literally a five minute walk from the main square and La Ramblas (market with street venodors, entertainers, and shops and cafe). In the main squre you can catch a tourist bus that takes you to all the main attractions around the the city. However we preffered to just walk. Everything was within walking distance from the hotel and if not the subway (metro) was just a 1 min walk away. The hotel staff was good a providing clear explaination and directions. Also they are sure to warn you about pickpockets. SO hold on to ur purses and watch ur pockets! The rooms were very simple, but clean. There was a tv with only one english channel. The Beds were hard and the room was very noisey. At night you could hear ppl talking in the hall or hear ppl flushing their toilets. I was too jetlagg to let it keep me from sleeping though. Our hotel did have a european breakfast however it was not included in the price of our room. Nothing to shout about, just bread, pastries, juice, coffee, butter, jam toast. Thats about it. It was 4 euros per person. For 12 euro you could get cereal yogurt and cold meat, boiled eggs but we didnt bother as we were boarding a ship later that day. Check out was simple at 11am and they kept our bags again so we could explore the city a bit more before boarding the ship. They even called a taxi for us, unfortunatley our taxi ripped us off on the price to the dock as it was only a 5-10 min drive. You could actually walk, but again their are so many pickpockets and its all uphill. So think twice. About a 40 min walk to the ship dock (royal caribbean) The bathroom was modern with shower caps, fresh towels and bar soap. All in all, if you only need a place to stay for one or two nights this place is good however it was a bit expensive for a 3 star but the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you are taking a cruise from the port in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler640
Reviews.Content: We stayed just for one night- the price was incredibly cheap for the cleanliness and modern design of the hotel. The hotel staff were friendly and spoke English. The hotel is also right near Las Ramblas, which is a famous tourist shopping street in Barcelona- just keep your wallets close because there are a lot of pick pockets! The only downfall to the hotel itself is that because it is modern in design with tile on all floors and walls; any talking, walking, or closing of doors in the hallway echoes through your room and may prevent a sound sleep if you are a light sleeper. However, if your stay is just for a night or two and then you are cruising, it's a great hotel because we were able to walk to our cruise ship- it was a 45 minute walk, but doable and safe. If you are staying in Barcelona not for cruising but for the city itself, you may want to stay in the heart of the city because there is more shopping and interesting streets that look a lot like Paris in the other section of the city, including the beautiful Gothic Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “If you can spend $20 more-avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: perely
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very close to Las Ramblas (only 5 min to walk), which is good, but doors to the hotel are always closed and are open only by maintaining visual contact with a receptionist. This is kind of an indicator how safe the location of the hotel is. Rooms are incredibly small, so you can barely walk in, and do not have space for your luggage. They have A/C but not in "off season" time. They do have wireless internet, which is very slow... Rooms probably had not been maintained for the last 30 years. Bed covers are dirty with a lot of old spots. They do not change sheets and towels. In the bathroom you cannot find anything what you expect to find in Motel 6. Some rooms have a view to the windows or balconies of the very close next building (like 2-3 meters from your window) from which you can observe neighbors underwear in the process of drying and enjoy the smell of their cooking. We demanded to change the room. Do not even think to order a breakfast - this is rip off even for 8 euros. If you do not want spoil your vacation to the beautiful Barcelona - avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: PemberleyDerbyshire
Reviews.Content: Quiet, clean, in a good spot, nice service, wireless internet, decent price. Room a bit sparse but no problems with staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here - awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller1179
Reviews.Content: Very poor customer service by staff members. We checked into a tiny, dark, room. Lights over bed didnt work. The shower temperature changed every few seconds. I liked the location of this hotel, but that was all I liked about it.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of everything. Hotel fair”
Reviews.Author: Tess28Chicago_USA
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is close to Las ramblas and La Ravel. La Ravel is a more seedier side of Barcelona. If you want a minimalist room and fair service, this is it. There are plenty of restaurants nearby. Try to get a room on the upper floors due to latenight revelers walking by

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: GirlMick
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights in March. I had emailed the hotel direct a few days beforehand to let them know that we would be checking in late due to flight times etc and not only were they extremely prompt in responding but they also sent maps and other information not only about how to get to the hotel but also about the local area. When we did arrive the receptionist was extremely helpful and her English was definately better than my Spanish. She had plenty of maps and information on where to go which came in really handy. The hotel itself is in a fantastic location. About 400 yards from the metro Paral-lel which gets you to all the major tourist attractions as well as being the place to catch the funicular up to the cable car for a great view over Barcelona. Walk the other way out of the hotel and it's a 2 minute walk to Las Ramblas or the marina. The room we stayed in was room 603 and the one and only negative comment I have about it is that the aircon didn't work very well which wasn't a problem for us in March but if you stay in the summer, it definately would be! The room isn't massive but is ok as a sleepover point. The bathroom had a great power shower cubicle in it which was great after hours of pounding the spanish streets. Other reviews haven't been complimentary about the area but to be honest we had no problems here whatsoever. The hotel is situated on a busy road and is well lit and so I didn't feel uneasy about the area at all. A good hotel which I would definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but TERRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: seg7
Reviews.Content: First impressions of this hotel were excellent. Very high standard 3 star hotel in good location with easy access to the metro. However, the service at this hotel is severely lacking. We booked a double room through easytobook.com for Valentine's weekend. We entered our room to discover two single beds instead of a double. When I complained I was told that 'Booking a double is not guaranteed, it all depends on availability. If you wanted a double you should have noted it in the comments on your booking form'. Firstly, the room I selected on the website was a double so why would I need to note in the comments. Secondly, they didn't think the fact that they couldn't accommodate our booking correctly warranted prior notification? It was after all Valentines - two single beds, not exactly romantic! I was then told that they would most likely be able to move us to a double room the following night. After no attempt to offer any compensation, I suggested that maybe we could have a complimentary breakfast due to the inconvenience. The receptionist said she would need to contact her manager and to cut a very long and frustrating story short this began a series of back and forth between several staff members as they referred the situation to others. The major lack of service and constant passing the buck made for a disappointing and frustrating experience at this hotel. It was a shame because if the service had been better I would have rated in 5 stars. Be warned - when making an internet booking for this hotel, be sure you call and confirm you are definitely getting the room you requested.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug89129
Reviews.Content: I knew that staying at a 3-star hotel would not put me at the Ritz, but this place was a dump, complete with feces and vomit on the front sidewalk and a man hitting a woman with a bottle while their dogs fought just around the corner. The heater in our room never worked the entire time we were there, while the outside temp was no more than 45 F. Breakfast was not available unless we had ordered it the night before. And the excuse for all of this was that we were there on a holiday. The one nice thing was that we were allowed to keep our luggage in their storage closet till our flight time later in the day. The reviews I read before booking made it sound like a decent place. Not the case! There must be better hotels in Barcelona!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ditto what other reviewers wrote - great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: ECCohen
Reviews.Content: Hesperia is a great value hotel especially if you're booking on the weekend (cheaper than anything else I could find around the city center). They have wireless internet, located on Avenguda Parallel which is a 10 minute walk to the Christopher Columbus Statue at the bottom of La Rambla. Breakfast was overpriced so we didn't get it but otherwise we were very happy with this hotel. Highly recommended for tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed...location, price”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaCoonass
Reviews.Content: Our first stop in our first European trip. Front desk Staff VERY friendly and helpful... After an overnight flight, they us to check in early, when we just expected to have them store our luggage for a few hours before checkin time. The following morning we noticed that I forgot to pack hairspray, went to front desk to ask location of nearest store and she indicated that they were all closed on Sunday, she went to her purse and handed me her personal supply. NOW THAT is helpful staff! Location is in la Rambla area and within a 4-5 block walk to pick up tour buses. We used Bus Turistic which was very informative and well worth the money. Great for first time travelers to Barcelona. Several eateries close by as well. Room was very clean and updated. Bed was more comfortable than it looked (looked like a box). Bathroom was modern, clean and well kept but must say this is where I say be careful!!! The shower floor was very slippery and only a partial glass wall (see pic on this site of bath) and then open to the room. We both almost fell and it would most likely been a serious injury.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: kilkelly5
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service from the so called manager who could not manage to come out of his office and explain why he broke his promise and ruined our first wedding anniversary. very dissapointed customer!

Reviews.Title: “Good Spot”
Reviews.Author: beefyTo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night prior to a cruise. It is fairly close to the port so the taxi fare is not too expensive (15 euros, 4 persons). The hotel was 100 euros for the night and was modern and clean. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and helpful especially Sonia who spoke very good english and could not do enough for us. Will stay again if we are in Barcelona. Be aware of very talented pick pockets in Barcelona. Sonia told us she has been a victim 3 times this year. I spotted a women about 20 move beside my sister in law and move her hand to my sister in law's pouch. After yelling at the pick pocket and belting her with my walking stick across the rear she left.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel with hlepful staff”
Reviews.Author: ScotsGirls
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in March. the hotel is in an excellent location, reasonably priced and had friendly, helpful staff...what more can u want!

Reviews.Title: “Underrated. Good location, Modern comfort.”
Reviews.Author: brookl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a real find. We spent 4 nights here in June. A great location on Paral.lel... 7-8 minute walk from La Rambla, 3 minute walk from nearest subway station (Diagonal) and the funicular that whisks you up to Montjuic, 10 minute walk from the port area where the seaside shopping complex is. A lot of tourists prefer to stay in the middle of action right on La Rambla or in and around the Old City, but I personally prefer this hotel's location since the area's not quite as hectic. The rooms are more modern and cleaner and the service is much more professional than what I expected of a 3-star Spanish hotel. The front desk staff is helpful and efficient and all speak English well. The guestroom was very clean; maybe it was recently renovated. The bathroom had a very modern design, with glass shower door. The housekeeping was generous in replenishing toiletries (which were of pretty good quality) and towels everyday... not something you can count on at every 3-star hotel in mediterranean Europe. Beds were not that comfortable, but not too horrible either. Back to the location issue... if you take the straight path from the hotel to La Ramble, you'd be walking through a bit of a rough area of Barcelona. If you're a woman, my best advice is to be mindful of your belongings during the day and to avoid walking there alone altogether at night. We would definitely stay here again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DarrellNI
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire and got a great deal for two nights before our cruise. The hotel has one of the best overal in Barcelona, within a few yards to the underground, five minutes walk to Las Ramblas and five minutes walk to the beautiful modern port area where there are endless walks and pleasure boat trips available. We were going on a cruise and needed a taxi to get to the cruise port (12 - 20 euro, depending on the driver). The trip in from the airport cost just over 30 Euros and takes about 20 minutes depending on traffic although evening rush hours can take over an hour easily. The hotel staff were excellent and they offer free WiFi access or broadband using their own business centre if you do not carry your own laptop. The breakfast buffet in the hotel is a bit limited but if you purchase breakfasts for the full duration of your stay it will only cost 9.50 Euro and is very reasonable as the food is of good quality although the hot items are a bit limited. Or if you prefer there are plenty of restaurants and bakeries within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern hotel, small but nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: lehovec
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location, 5 minutes walk to the port and Ramblas, 2 minutes walk from funicular to Montjuic. Location couldn't be better with plenty of nice and cheap restaurants around. Reception staff polite and helpfull. Check in/out quick. Room was small but very nice, with nice and modern bathroom. However it is not very bright and we had room on the 7th floor, the view was like being in Baghdad with Middle East style roof tops but it didn't bother us too much. :-) I would say try and get the room facing the main road but it is quite busy and probably noisy. Room equipped with safe, mini bar, bed comfy and big. Air conditioning throughout the hotel. When I go to Barcelona next time surely this is going to be the first hotel I'll look into.

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: npnLondon
Reviews.Content: just got back from barca for a lads holiday last week. stayed here for four nights. the location of the hotel was one of the best things about it. about a 10 min walk form Las Ramblas. The rooms are of adequte size and always kept spotless. showers are great, although in one room water was leaking from the door. The pillows were very comfortale, as mentioned in another review. the bathrooms and rooms have a modern feel. We only had breakfast once, cant reccomend it however. The staff were excellent, helpful and very tolerant, considering how much noise we made one night. noise travels easily in the hotel so try get a room on the top floor. overall i would reccomend this hotel to anybody for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geoffmick
Reviews.Content: Small, clean, comfortable hotel with very friendly staff. Not far from the waterfont and La Ramblas. No restaurant but a small area offering a very nice buffet breakfast. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Hesperia del Port
HotelInfo.Address: Avenida Paralelo 40, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
